metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8686 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The bm_new function in bitmap.h in potrace 1.13 allows remote attackers tohave unspecified impact via a crafted image, which triggers a memoryallocation failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8686` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpotrace0 - 1.14-2
potrace - 1.14-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: potrace package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.14-2').
